input_config.human_message:
Based on information 
Theme: {{theme}}
Object: {{object}}
Background: {{background}} 
Layout: {{layout}} 
Color: {{color}}
Style: {{style}} 
Write a concise prompt maximum 150 words to generate image. 
Example: 
Long Prompt: Reaching for the Stars (Flat Design)
Concept: This flat design illustration captures the excitement and ambition of humanity's pursuit of new frontiers in technology. A powerful rocket ship blasts off into a vast starry sky, symbolizing the journey towards a future filled with endless possibilities.
Foreground:
Rocket Ship:
Design: Modern and sleek, with a streamlined body and powerful engines.
Details:
Glowing exhaust flames at the base, signifying the rocket's launch.
Bold geometric shapes and contrasting colors (e.g., white body with red accents) for a dynamic appearance.
Windows with bright lights inside, hinting at the crew or equipment on board.
Launch Pad: A minimalist platform with geometric shapes, sturdy enough to handle the rocket's force.
Background:
Starry Sky:
Base Color: Dark blue or black.
Stars: Abundant, in various sizes and brightnesses, creating a sense of depth and vastness.
Optional Details:
Nebulae: Swirling clouds of gas and dust in vibrant colors like purple, pink, and blue, adding visual interest without overwhelming the flat design style.
Shooting Stars: Streaks of light across the sky symbolizing fleeting moments of inspiration and breakthroughs.
Horizon: A subtle suggestion of a planet or moon peeking over the horizon, possibly humanity's home base or the target destination.
Color Palette:
Bold and Eye-Catching:
Primary Colors: Consider a combination of white for the rocket ship, red or orange for the launch flames and accents, and blue for the starry sky.
Secondary Colors: Introduce contrasting or complementary colors in the nebulae, shooting stars, or horizon details (e.g., purple, green, yellow).
Balance: Maintain a balance between the excitement of bold colors and the clean lines of the flat design aesthetic.
Overall Tone:
Uplifting and Energetic: The image should evoke a sense of optimism and excitement about the future of technological exploration.
Dynamic and Inspiring: The composition and color palette should create a sense of movement and inspire viewers to dream big.

nodes.name: llm_5
nodes.title: Define Brand Personality
nodes.description: Answer a question using a large language model. Chat history can be used to maintain context between messages.

input_config.human_message:
Brand facts: {{brand_facts}} 
Your brand personality should answer these important questions:
What is Brand Personality?
Brand personality refers to the human-like characteristics attributed to a brand, which help create an emotional connection with customers. Imagine your brand as a person with specific traits, like being elegant, adventurous, or down-to-earth. These attributes make your brand relatable and memorable, allowing customers to identify with it on a deeper level.By developing a distinct brand personality, you can foster a stronger bond with your target audience, making it easier for them to choose your brand over competitors and stay loyal over time.
Why Does Brand Personality Matter?
Brand personality is a critical component of brand positioning and differentiation. An effective brand personality humanizes a brand, giving it depth and nuance, and making it relatable to its target audience.
Brand personality is the part of your brand that your customers identify with and build a relationship with. Because of this, it plays a huge role in driving customer acquisition, fostering brand loyalty, and building brand equity.
Its personality is why Starbucks customers feel so at home in its cafes, and why BMW customers can’t picture themselves driving anything else.
A well-defined and effectively implemented brand personality…
Drives Competitive Differentiation
Brand personality is one of the most important factors in differentiating your brand from the competition. The same product or service can be marketed in distinctly different ways depending on personality.
The key is cultivating a personality that is authentic to your organization, consistent over time, and relatable to your ideal customer.
Boosts Brand Awareness
A distinct brand personality makes your brand experience both recognizable and memorable. These are the key components to brand awareness.
Brand awareness isn’t just about potential new customers becoming aware of your brand through marketing and promotion. It’s also about fostering awareness in existing customers, so it evolves from recognition to preference.
Bolsters Brand Loyalty
No one leverages the power of personality better than Apple. The brand’s devotees see themselves—if, perhaps, idealized versions of themselves—in the sleek, artistic, somewhat nonconventional personality the brand has cultivated over decades of purposeful advertising.
This has resulted in a legion of brand-loyal customers whose identities are at least partially defined by ownership of an Apple product.
Your brand personality should answer these important questions:
1. what 5-10 adjectives or traits that best describe your brand?
2. Which of the 12 brand archetypes most align with your brand values and characteristics?
The Innocent: Simplicity, honesty, purity, optimism, trust, goodness.
The Explorer: Adventure, discovery, freedom, non-conformity, curiosity.
The Sage: Wisdom, knowledge, expertise, learning, mentorship, insight.
The Hero: Courage, strength, determination, resilience, problem-solving.
The Outlaw Rebellion, rule-breaking, challenging norms, disruption.
The Magician: Transformation, wonder, imagination, creativity, innovation.
The Lover: Passion, intimacy, connection, desire, romance, sensuality
The Jester: Fun, humor, playfulness, entertainment, light-heartedness.
The Everyman: Relatability, approachability, authenticity, support
The Caregiver: Nurturing, compassion, support, empathy, protection.
The Ruler: Authority, control, leadership, stability, order, power
The Creator: Innovation, self-expression, originality, artistry, vision
input_config.system_message:

ui_metadata.value:
Unlike Nvidia’s traditional GPUs for gaming, Project Digits isn’t targeting consumers. Instead, it’s aimed at machine-learning researchers, smaller companies, and universities that want to develop advanced AI but don’t have billions of dollars to build massive data centers or buy enough cloud credits.

“There’s a gaping hole for data scientists and ML researchers and who are actively working, who are actively building something,” Huang said. “Maybe you don’t need a giant cluster. You’re just developing the early versions of the model, and you’re iterating constantly. You could do it in the cloud, but it just costs a lot more money.”

The supercomputer will cost about $3,000 when it hits the market in May, Nvidia said, and it will be available from the company itself as well as some of its manufacturing partners. Huang said Project Digits is a placeholder name, indicating it may change by the time the computer goes on sale.

“If you have a good name for it, reach out to us,” Huang said.

- Key elements: data analysis, personalization

More Examples:

Output:

## Guidelines
1. Identify key themes from input:
- Main subject/concept
- Core activities
- Target mood/feeling
- Industry context
2. Transform abstract concepts into visual elements:
- Convert data into floating displays
- Show processes as flowing energy/light
- Represent connections as networks/patterns
- Use color to convey mood
3. Structure prompt with:
- Central visual element
- Environmental context
- Lighting and atmosphere
- Style and technical specifications
4. Always include:
- Concrete visual details
- Modern tech elements
- Atmospheric effects
- Professional finish markers
Remember: Create visually striking scenes that capture the essence of the marketing message while maintaining professional and technological themes.

input_config.human_message:
You are a world-class LinkedIn content creator, known for your ability to craft posts that deeply resonate with your target audience. Your process follows a step-by-step approach to ensure high-quality content every single time.
Initially, you will dissect the LinkedIn post, understanding its key elements and how it delivers its message.
Then, you will write 3 different variations of the same post. It's not about copying the original post, but rather, creating high-quality content that conveys the same message in a unique way that suits the target audience.
Afterwards, you will dive into the crucial part.
- To begin with, you will pinpoint the ways in which each variation can be altered to better resonate with the target audience (considering factors like tone, language, structure, and even the inclusion of new analogies or metaphors if it fits the audience's preferences). You need to have a clear reasoning for each change. List these as a semicolon-separated list.
- Following that, based on your reasoning, you will modify each variation to include these changes.
- Once you have revised the variations, you will critique each one, deciding if it's high-quality enough to meet your standards.
- Do this process continuously, until you are confident that your work is faultless. Repeat no less than two times, and no more than ten times.
Here is the Markdown format you will use to respond:
```
## Analysis of Original LinkedIn Post
- Element 1: $element1_description
- Element 2: $element2_description
- ...
## Initial Variations
### Variation 1
$initial_text_variation1
### Variation 2
$initial_text_variation2
### Variation 3
$initial_text_variation3
---
### Iteration 1
#### Changes to Implement for Resonating with Audience
##### Variation 1
$change1_for_iteration1; $change2_for_iteration1...
##### Variation 2
$change1_for_iteration1; $change2_for_iteration1...
##### Variation 3
$change1_for_iteration1; $change2_for_iteration1...
#### Rewritten Variations
##### Variation 1
$rewritten_text_variation1_iteration1
##### Variation 2
$rewritten_text_variation2_iteration1
##### Variation 3
$rewritten_text_variation3_iteration1
#### Critique
##### Variation 1
$critique_variation1_iteration1
##### Variation 2
$critique_variation2_iteration1
##### Variation 3
$critique_variation3_iteration1
---
(Repeat iterations as needed, up to 10 times)
---

LinkedIn post content:
{{post_text}} 
Here is the description of the target audience(s):

Remember, at each step, try to match the style as closely as you can and deeply resonate with the target audience.

You are a skilled sales transcript summarizer who works for a product team. You excel at extracting the most important details from sales transcripts and summarizing them into concise bullet points that the product team can easily review.

Company Name: [Insert Company's Name]

- [Bullet point 1]
- [Bullet point 2]
- [Bullet point 3, 4, ... etc.]
Use Cases / Value Propositions
[Highlight how your product/service can address the pain points and how it adds value to their processes.]
[Bullet point 1]
[Bullet point 2]
[Bullet point 3, 4, ... etc.]
Key Takeaways / Action Items
[Record the conclusions of the call, any commitments made, or follow-ups required.]
[Bullet point 1]
[Bullet point 2]
[Bullet point 3, 4, ... etc.]

Role (N/A if unsure): [Insert Role, if known]

The client is highly impressed with the software's ability to process data quickly and its stability compared to previous solutions which frequently crashed.
They highlighted a steep learning curve for new users and suggested the addition of more tutorials or in-app guides.
The client also mentioned the high cost of the software but acknowledged its value in saving time and reducing frustration.
Feedback on customer support was negative, particularly regarding long wait times, with a suggestion to introduce an online chat feature.
Interest was expressed in a potential mobile version of the software.

Potential for increased user adoption with improved onboarding materials and support.

nodes.description: Answer a question using a large language model. Chat history can be used to maintain context between messages.

input_config.human_message: Meta Description: {{brainstorm_meta_description.content}}
input_config.system_message:
# Image Prompt Generation Instructions
You are a prompt generation AI. Your task is to convert marketing descriptions, hashtags, or concept descriptions into detailed visual prompts. Extract key themes and visualize them as concrete imagery.
## Example Conversions:
Input: "Discover how AI's deep learning transforms event planning by analyzing attendee preferences and behaviors for personalized experiences. #EventTech #AI"
Analysis:
- Core concept: AI and event planning
- Key elements: data analysis, personalization
- Visual themes: technology, events, interaction
- Mood: futuristic, professional
Output:
Futuristic AI interface with glowing neural network patterns and holographic attendee profiles, displayed in a modern event planning control room, illuminated by soft blue ambient lighting, with data streams and preference analysis visualizations floating in the air, cyberpunk-inspired digital art style, ultra detailed, photorealistic rendering, 8k resolution
More Examples:
Input: "Empower your growth mindset with our revolutionary learning platform. #EdTech #Innovation"
Output:
Luminous digital tree of knowledge with branches made of interconnected light pathways and glowing wisdom nodes, emerging from a sleek tablet device in a minimalist study space, bathed in warm inspirational lighting, floating educational symbols and progress indicators shimmer in the air, modern digital art style, ultra detailed, volumetric lighting, 8k resolution
Input: "Experience nature's power through sustainable energy innovation. #CleanTech #Renewable"
Output:
Elegant wind turbine with flowing organic curves and bioluminescent accents, standing tall against a dramatic sunset sky, rays of golden light filtering through passing clouds, with floating data visualizations showing energy flow, surrounded by wildflower meadow, eco-futuristic art style, photorealistic detail, atmospheric lighting, 8k resolution
## Guidelines
1. Identify key themes from input:
- Main subject/concept
- Core activities
- Target mood/feeling
- Industry context
2. Transform abstract concepts into visual elements:
- Convert data into floating displays
- Show processes as flowing energy/light
- Represent connections as networks/patterns
- Use color to convey mood
3. Structure prompt with:
- Central visual element
- Environmental context
- Lighting and atmosphere
- Style and technical specifications
4. Always include:
- Concrete visual details
- Modern tech elements
- Atmospheric effects
- Professional finish markers
Remember: Create visually striking scenes that capture the essence of the marketing message while maintaining professional and technological themes.

ui_metadata.value:
Scenario: David, a salesperson for a cloud-based HR software company, is on a discovery call with Sarah, the HR Manager at a rapidly growing tech startup.

David (Salesperson): Hi Sarah, thanks for taking the time to chat today.  To kick things off, can you tell me a little bit about [Company Name] and the current size of your HR team? (Metrics)

Sarah (Prospect): Hi David, thanks for reaching out. We're a growing startup with about 150 employees, but that number is expected to double in the next year.  Right now, it's just me and an assistant handling all HR duties.

David: Interesting.  With that kind of growth, I imagine keeping up with onboarding, payroll, and benefits administration can be challenging.  Have you encountered any specific issues in managing HR for a growing team? (Economic Buyer)

Sarah: Absolutely.  Everything is very manual right now, and it's getting difficult to keep track of employee records and ensure compliance.  Payroll processing takes a lot of time and leaves room for errors.

David: That makes sense.  Can you tell me more about the impact these challenges have on your business?  For example, are there any delays in onboarding new hires, or have there been any compliance issues? (Implication)

Sarah: Fortunately, no compliance issues yet, but onboarding is definitely taking longer than ideal.  New hires get frustrated waiting for access to systems and benefits information.

David:  I understand.  [Software Name] can help streamline your HR processes by automating tasks like onboarding, payroll, and benefits administration.  Our cloud-based platform allows you to manage everything in one place, saving you valuable time and resources. (Decision Criteria)

Sarah: That sounds promising.  Who else within the company would be involved in the decision-making process for a new HR software solution? (Decision Process)

David: Typically, the CFO and CEO would also be involved, along with any department heads who rely on HR data for reporting purposes.

David:  Would you be open to a demo next week where I can show you how [Software Name] can address your specific needs and help you manage your growing team more efficiently? (Champion)

Sarah: Sure, that sounds like a good next step.

ui_metadata.value:
Nvidia’s tiny $3,000 computer for AI developers steals the show at CES
Unlike Nvidia’s traditional GPUs for gaming, Project Digits isn’t targeting consumers. Instead, it’s aimed at machine-learning researchers, smaller companies, and universities that want to develop advanced AI but don’t have billions of dollars to build massive data centers or buy enough cloud credits.

“There’s a gaping hole for data scientists and ML researchers and who are actively working, who are actively building something,” Huang said. “Maybe you don’t need a giant cluster. You’re just developing the early versions of the model, and you’re iterating constantly. You could do it in the cloud, but it just costs a lot more money.”

The supercomputer will cost about $3,000 when it hits the market in May, Nvidia said, and it will be available from the company itself as well as some of its manufacturing partners. Huang said Project Digits is a placeholder name, indicating it may change by the time the computer goes on sale.

“If you have a good name for it, reach out to us,” Huang said.

workflow.name: Event recap email
workflow.description: Automatically send an email summarizing your event

nodes.name: llm
nodes.title: Answers
nodes.description: Answer a question using a large language model. Chat history can be used to maintain context between messages.

input_config.human_message:
Write an event recap email to {{attendee_email}} about the {{event_name}} event {{date}} . 
Include key highlights from the event {{speaker_topic}} {{highlights}}, feedback from participants {{survey_link}} , and next steps. Example: Subject: Recap of the [Event Name] Event - Thank You for Attending! Dear [Attendees], I hope this email finds you well! On behalf of the organizing team, I would like to express our sincere gratitude for attending the [Event Name] event. It was truly a pleasure to have you join us. Here is a recap of the key highlights from the event: Opening remarks: The event kicked off with an inspiring speech from [Keynote Speaker]. Their insights and experiences set the tone for the day, leaving everyone motivated and engaged. Panel discussions: Our panel of industry experts shared valuable knowledge and engaged in thought-provoking discussions on various topics, including [Topic 1], [Topic 2], and [Topic 3]. The diverse perspectives offered great insights and allowed for an interactive and engaging session. Networking sessions: The event provided ample opportunities for attendees to connect with fellow professionals in the industry. The networking sessions were well-received, as participants appreciated the chance to exchange ideas, forge new relationships, and even explore potential collaborations. Workshop sessions: The hands-on workshop sessions proved to be a crowd favorite. Participants had the opportunity to enhance their skills in [Workshop Topic 1], [Workshop Topic 2], and [Workshop Topic 3]. The interactive nature of these sessions allowed for a more immersive learning experience. We are thrilled to share that the event received overwhelmingly positive feedback from participants. Here are a few comments we received: "The event was incredibly informative and well-organized. Thank you for providing such valuable content!" "I thoroughly enjoyed the panel discussions. The speakers were knowledgeable and engaging." "The networking sessions were a great way to build connections and learn from others in the industry." "The workshop sessions helped me gain practical skills that I can apply in my work immediately." In terms of next steps, we have taken your feedback into consideration and are in the process of planning our next event. We will keep you informed about the dates, topics, and registration details via email and our website. Once again, thank you for making the [Event Name] event a resounding success. We appreciate your participation and look forward to seeing you at future events. Should you have any further questions or suggestions, please do not hesitate to reach out to us. Best regards, [Your Name] {{your_name}} [Your Title/Organization] {{your_tilte}}

ui_metadata.value:
A TV show poster for a parody series titled "Breaking Bread," playing on the name of the famous show Breaking Bad. The poster features a stern-looking baker in a flour-dusted apron, with a rolling pin slung over his shoulder like a weapon. He stands in the middle of a rustic bakery, surrounded by stacks of bread loaves, pastries, and bags of flour, all arranged to mimic the iconic desert backdrop from the original show.

Behind him, the bakery's chalkboard menu lists items like "Cinnamon Swirl Cartel" and "Blueberry Muffin Meth," hinting at the culinary chaos that’s about to unfold. The baker’s expression is intense, yet comically serious, as if he's about to take on the world with nothing but his dough and determination.

The title "Breaking Bread" is displayed in bold, stylized text at the top, with the "Breaking" in a gritty, cracked font, while "Bread" is written in warm, golden letters resembling freshly baked loaves. The tagline beneath reads, "Baking is a Dangerous Game," adding to the pun-filled humor.

The overall color scheme of the poster is a mix of warm, bakery hues with the gritty, dark tones reminiscent of the original show, blending the intense drama of Breaking Bad with the lighthearted, culinary twist of "Breaking Bread."
